data.message: I used to believe that. What I have learned is that people have certain needs and wants. When you are in need, friends change tier priorities. If they don't like your world is falling apart...they wil turn to someone else, who makes THEM feel good. Friendship is a responsibility...most people don't want to put time and effort in it. There is always someone ELSE to take your place. Sad but true.

replies.message: Those aren't friends they were using you. I've had one friend for 40 years and another friend for 31 years and they both was their for me when I was down,broke and lost .I was told in order to have a friend you must first learn how to be a friend.
I totally agree thought certain people were my friends only to find out they were not.  Better to have a few true friends than a bunch of phonies
I try to be a true friend and usually find friendship returned. All relationships take effort, but the repayment is always joyful
I know people that think they have good friends,but as soon as their back is turned they're talking crap about them. Better to accept that people are not to be trusted too fully.
